global_property.description: DO NOT MODIFY. Current database version number for the mrngen module.
Flag representing whether the setup for MRN Generation is complete or not
DO NOT MODIFY. true/false whether or not the mrngen module has been started. This is used to make sure modules that were running prior to a restart are started again
The comma separated list of HL7 message types to accepted by the MessageTypeCritic (if used).
The comma separated list of processing ids to be accepted by the ProcessingIdCritic (if used).
The comma separated list of HL7 message segment names the CandidateResultFinder will scan for candidate results.
DO NOT MODIFY. The current installed version of the module specific concepts.
DO NOT MODIFY. Current database version number for the ncd module.
True to enable NTE segment processing, false to disable it.
The TCP port to which the HL7 message processor should listen for incoming connections.
The maximum size of the (loinc, facility) frequency cache.
The longest common substring matching threshold, as a percentage.
The comma separated list of message critic class names to be loaded.
transform one message type to another
The comma separated list of negation strings to search for in test results to indicate a negative result.
The name of the analyzer class used by RexCritic.
The comma separated list of non-reportable abnormal result flags (OBX.8) used by the AbnormalFlagCritic, if it is used.
The password of the user as whom the NCD processor will run.

The comma separated list of reportable abnormal result flags (OBX.8) used by the AbnormalFlagCritic, if it is used. Reportable flags always override not-reportable flags. So if a flag appears in both lists, it will be reported.
The comma separated list of name=class name pairs to be loaded as result finders.
The comma separated list of results critic class names to be loaded.
mapping from segment name to model class
DO NOT MODIFY. true/false whether or not the ncd module has been started. This is used to make sure modules that were running prior to a restart are started again
The name of the user as whom the NCD processor will run.
